reviews.review_msg: He is one of the BEST profs in SFU. REALLY knows his material and tries the best to make everything crystal clear. Very helpful and simplies all material for you. Go to lecture, it'll make ur life way easier. Not the easiest but u learn a lot at the end of day!

The group project is a lot of work so make sure you find a good group to work with. Overall there's a lot of material, but Dennis explains everything very clearly and is very helpful if you need clarification. I'd recommend taking this course with him.

He teaches very well. Very helpful for group assignments and guiding you in the right direction. The course itself is heavy, but he made it easier by being available for help and explaining concepts well. I'd take the course with him again if I had to.

Awesome prof! He's really enthusiastic about what he teaches. Super approachable and funny! he's not easy, you really have to work hard in his classes but he'll explain concepts to you over and over in office hours if you dont understand st! would recommend everyone take this "useful" class with him. he'll definitely change your view on accounting!
A very enthusiastic prof.  Spends way too much time on long equations that don't really tell you much about accounting.  All in all a useless class with a decent prof.
Very cool guy! He even told us about the time his house got broken into!

This course is ridiculous.  He teaches about 5 weeks of the semester, and the rest of the weeks are student presentations.  This is basically a self taught course.  He's just there to mark your work.  He offers very little guidance in class.
he is a hard marker!

Kim is very dedicated to knowledge and research. In addition, she is very helpful and will walk you through your problems as long as you demonstrate your interests in the topics. The amount of work of this class was fair and just enough to demonstrate your  knowledge learned in class.
Worst prof I've had at SFU. Nice person but cannot teach. You're better off teaching yourself the material. Bright side, class average was really low so the curve will save you.

Kim is a good prof. The exam was fair and so was her marking. She responds in a timely manner and also helped us prep for the exam by giving us questions and review. I believe this class is always taught by students - it's not because the prof(s) are lazy. She also has good style - every seminar she came in with a nice business suit.
Kim did a great job presenting papers and encouraging discussion. The final exam was fair, as was the marking of presentations and papers.

The class is taught as a seminar because that's the format required by SFU not because the prof is lazy. The course was more useful than I thought it would be. The prof was very helpful with emails and after class.
Lazy professor. Assigns seminars to groups to teach the class. Why am I spending so much on tuition to be taught by peers?

He is a nice guy at heart. However, the main issue is that he subconsciously stereotypes students and assigns grades accordingly. What I am saying is, it is impossible to get a high mark if you're Asian and quiet in the class. Try to get to know him personally, talk in class, and become one of his favorites and you will do well regardless.
Very Good

Amazing prof, seriously! He keeps you interested in the material, and is VERY helpful after class, during break, at office hours, etc. Had him now for 2 semesters and am taking another class with him next semester.
awesome
Stephen's a good teacher but an even better person.  His courses themselves are okay, but the guy himself is awesome.  One of my favourite instructors by semesters' end.  Also applies to 424

That's the easiest course to teach. He doesn't have to say anything or provide any lecture notes because the students will do it for him. Do you want to study by using student-version powerpoint slieds? Good luck, then. They are not reliable and vague.
